identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Prognostic Factors in Patients Admitted to ICU for Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study of Prognostic Factors in Patients Admitted to ICU for Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Outcome of stroke patients admitted to the intensive care unit the intensive care unit (ICU) is poor and haemorrhagic stroke, fixed dilated pupil(s) and GCS \<10 are associated with increased mortality and poor functional outcome. However little is known about the impact of clinical events occuring during the ICU stay (ventilator acquired pneumoniae, shock, dysglycemia....).

The objective of this study was to determine the mortality rate and the functional outcomes of stroke patients admitted to ICU and to identify predictors of poor outcome in this population.

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through ICU hospitalization, an average of one month

secondaryOutcomes.description: Modified Rankin Score (0: no symptoms at all; 6: dead)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at hospitalization discharge, an average of three months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* acute stroke
* ICU admission for acute stroke
* 1 organ dysfunction : coma, shock, respiratory failure

Exclusion Criteria:

* refuse participation
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients with acute stroke admitted to ICU in the Brest Teaching Hospital (Cavale Blanche) BREST (The Brest REgistry of STroke)

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will be available beginning two year and ending five years following the end study
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
